content.rendered:
• Meet the MVPS – Hosted by Monica, Eric and Misty

    April 17, 2022

  • CloudAlly Thought Leader Talks

    We chat with Meighan about her ongoing Salesforce World Tour, the Salesforce Slack acquisition, Salesforce Ohana, Women In Tech, and more…

    Read More

    November 30, 2021

  • DFW SFDUG: Slack Development w/Meighan Brodkey

    Come listen to one of Accenture’s top minds on Salesforce/Slack Integration, Meighan Brodkey. She will share all that’s usable, new and upcoming around Slack.

    Read More

    November 28, 2021

  • Flow Training 1

    Let’s talk about flow baby – Part one of the community class on how to for flows

    Read More

    November 28, 2021

  • DSFUG Plugins Extension & Add-ons

    Presentation on tools extensions and apps for the Dallas Salesforce Developer User Group

    Read More

    November 21, 2021

  • Meet the MVPs

    Get acquainted with 5 amazing Salesforce MVPs who will share their secrets to success

    Read More

    November 21, 2021

  • Automation Hour 2021: Einstein Bot Flows & Omni-Channel Routing

    Curious about Einstein Bots, Flow, or the new Omni-Channel Routing functionality? In this episode of Automation Hour, you’ll learn about AI and all of that inside of Salesforce from Technical Architect & Salesforce MVP, Meighan Brodkey.

    Read More

    October 15, 2021

  • #DemystifySFProducts on Community Cloud with Meighan Brodkey

    Vijayawada, India Developers Group most fun-loving, informative, and successful session of #DemystifySFProducts on Community Cloud with Meighan Brodkey Session Link Cinco De Mayo for Salesforce YYC!! Join the Calgary User Group and me to learn about Community Cloud use cases for Partner, Customer, and unauthenticated Communities.we’ll dive into the different ways you can use Communities from submitting Leads and Opportunities, Self Service help portals, sharing content and more! Learn about how others use Community Cloud to connect, build their brand and better relationships; inspiring you to see the infinite possibilities for you and your Community.

    Read More

    December 22, 2020

  • Welly User Group: Community Cloud Expert

    Join me to talk Community Cloud security from scratch or audit your existing. We’ll review how to setup sharing sets, account relationships, channel programs, Apex sharing, profiles, and licenses. Better how the types of sharing work together, how to decide when to use each, and best practices for implementing a secure Community. I’ll even share some awesome apps to help you check guest perms, monitor, and maintain your user access to keep things running smoothly and your data safe and sound. Session Link Cinco De Mayo for Salesforce YYC!! Join the Calgary User Group and me to learn about Community Cloud use cases for Partner, Customer, and unauthenticated Communities.we’ll dive into the different ways you can use Communities from submitting Leads and Opportunities, Self Service help portals, sharing content and more! Learn about how others use Community Cloud to connect, build their brand and better relationships; inspiring you to see the infinite possibilities for you and your Community.

    Read More

    December 1, 2020

  • Virtual Dreamin 20

    Join Kenton san Miguel and Me when we present at Virtual Dreamin when we present on Community Cloud with our session, Control the Storm: Become a Lightning Community Master!

    Read More

    November 30, 2020

  • Mumbai WIT 2020

    Automation Hour: Rollup Summary Fileds w/ Lookup and Flow Overview Meighan Brodkey presents a great session on Rollup Summary Fields with Lookups.  Meighan takes the standard “Rollup” mentality to the next level with dynamic rollups based on what type of record is connected to the record.  An awesome scenario that can show you how to […]

    Read More

    November 30, 2020

  • Automation Hour w/ Meighan Brodkey Community Non-Account Based Sharing

    Meighan Brodkey presents a great session on Rollup Summary Fields with Lookups. Meighan takes the standard “Rollup” mentality to the next level with dynamic rollups based on what type of record is connected to the record. An awesome scenario that can show you how to take your automation to the next level! Also, lots of great questions so plenty for everyone of all skills to learn from.

    Read More

    November 23, 2020

  • Dallas Developer Group Road to CTA: July 2020

    July 22 as we gathered (virtually) to discuss News in the Salesforce world with our peers.Thrilled to join Dallas Developer User Group to share will share with us the How and Why I has undertaken the journey to CTA as well as advising others who are interested in pursuing. Learn the real lessons and hard truths I learned the hard way for you, and with others to help you get ahead.

    Read More

    November 16, 2020

  • Vancouver User Group: Become a Community Cloud Security Expert

    Join me to talk Community Cloud security from scratch or audit your existing. We’ll review how to setup sharing sets, account relationships, channel programs, Apex sharing, profiles, and licenses. Better how the types of sharing work together, how to decide when to use each, and best practices for implementing a secure Community. I’ll even share some awesome apps to help you check guest perms, monitor, and maintain your user access to keep things running smoothly and your data safe and sound. Session Link Cinco De Mayo for Salesforce YYC!! Join the Calgary User Group and me to learn about Community Cloud use cases for Partner, Customer, and unauthenticated Communities.we’ll dive into the different ways you can use Communities from submitting Leads and Opportunities, Self Service help portals, sharing content and more! Learn about how others use Community Cloud to connect, build their brand and better relationships; inspiring you to see the infinite possibilities for you and your Community.

    Read More

    May 15, 2020

  • Community Cloud Use Cases at the Calgary User Group

    Presentation on Community Cloud use cases for Partner, Customer, and unauthenticated Communities; reviewing different ways you can use Communities from submitting Leads and Opportunities, Self Service help portals, sharing content and more! Learn about how others use Community Cloud to connect, build their brand and better relationships; inspiring you to see the infinite possibilities for you and your Community.

    Read More

    May 15, 2020

  • Panaya: Best Practices for Maintaining Healthy Salesforce Architecture

    May 5 webinar with Guillermo Pedroni and myself tried and true best practices for maintaining healthy Salesforce Architecture. With tips on planning security, keeping your design simple – from the start, data cleanup & mapping and more.

    Read More

    May 15, 2020

  • WITDevs Fun with Flows

    Fun with Flows and best practices feat. Meighan Brodkey WITDevs User GroupApril 15, 2020 Fun with Flows and best practices feat. Meighan Brodkey For WITDevs User Group I presented on Flow on April 15 2020 virtually. The Talking about flow session covered flow basics, flow components, flow actions, flow best practices, and more.Post sesion there […]

    Read More

    April 15, 2020

  • Dreamforce Highlights from MVPs

    Salesforce MVPs, AI enthusiasts, futurists, and sceptics uncover what’s next for Salesforce across Sales, Service, Marketing, and IT. Featuring Leyna Hoffer, Shivanath Devinarayanan, Meighan Brodkey, Mohith Shrivastava, Rakesh Gupta, Jean Michel Mougeolle, Amit Chaudhary, Jan Vandevelde, Atul Gupta, Fabrice Cathala, Eric Dreshfield.

    Read More

    January 5, 2020

  • Community Sharing

    Community Sharing Salesforce User Groups – Seattle Women in TechDecember 14, 2019 Overeview Review the Profiles and Licenses differences in Communities as well as the differences in Sharing for Communities that are not available internal Salesforce.  Such as Sharing Sets, Account Relationships, Channel Programs, Apex Sharing.Learn what Sharing Sets, Account Relationships, Channel Programs, and Apex […]

    Read More

    January 5, 2020

  • Make A Mobile Publisher App for Communities Hands-on Virtual Workshop

    This virtual workshop was to learn how to build rich digital experiences for your partners using External Apps, enabling them to collaborate on data and processes that live both inside and outside of Salesforce. Then publish that experience to the web and to the App Store or Google Play and as a pixel perfect native mobile app, boosting engagement and adoption from anywhere. No coding required!

    Read More

    January 4, 2020

  • Dreamforce Admin & Dev Recap

    Join us as 3 Salesforce MVP‘s, Eric Dreshfield, Mike Martin, and Meighan Brodkey, bring Dreamforce ‘19 to you. Our Dreamforce19 recap panel will answer the questions you want to know about the best admin/dev sessions, favorite tips and takeaways and more.

    Read More

    December 10, 2019

  • Forcelandia 19: How Flow Can Help You Become a Developer

    Using Flow to Become a Developer ForcelandiaAugust 31-September 1, 2019 About Forcelandia A pleasant mix of APIs and IPAs, Forcelandia treats you to excellent topics on the Salesforce platform’s programmatic side. Forcelandia will again feature learning tracks and a line-up of intriguing speakers at this intimate tech event you won’t want to miss at The […]

    Read More

    November 1, 2019

  • How Flow Can Help You Become a Developer

    Using Flow to Become a Developer North Africa DreaminOctober 19, 2019 <!– –> North Africa Dreamin Why Participate? During this event, developers, administrators, business users and Salesforce partners will gather to train and share their knowledge and expertise. It will also be an opportunity for members to get to know Salesforce MVPs and share their […]

    Read More

    October 24, 2019

  • Automation Hour: Community Users with Flow and Platform Events

    Automation Hour 2019 Forgot UsernameSeptember 2019 Use Case Looking for a declarative way to do a forgot username on communities. No out of the box componentSecurity prevents guests from User Lookup The Presenters Meighan Brodkey Meighan is a technical architect and the leader of the Seattle Women in Tech User Group leader. With over 300 Trailhead […]

    Read More

    October 23, 2019

  • Connections 18: Content Management Solutions for Lightning Communities

    Content Management Solutions for Lightning Communities ConnectionsJune 13, 2018 Content Management Solutions for Lightning Communities Learn how easy it is to seamlessly integrate content from your Content Management System (CMS) into Lightning Communities with CMS Connect. With our new native content solution, start creating and managing your content in Salesforce to serve a rich, personalized […]

    Read More

    August 31, 2019

  • YeurDreamin 19: Build Your Own Lightning Community in a Flash

    Presentation in June 2019 at the first ever YeurDreamin in Amsterdam on Communities with hands on session to build a lightning community with templates. Access abstract, session deck, supporting resources and more here.

    Read More

    August 10, 2019

  • DF18: DemoJam – Custom Themes

    Salesforce lets you build your own custom themes, package them up, and share and re-use them internally as well as sharing them across the entire Salesforce ecosystem. To celebrate, we’re hosting a DemoJam where our Trailblazers will showcase their work, and the winner will be declared for the sharpest, coolest, and most beautiful theme.

    Read More

    November 18, 2018

  • Automation Hour w/ Meighan Brodkey Custom Rollup Summary Fields

    Meighan Brodkey presents a great session on Rollup Summary Fields with Lookups. Meighan takes the standard “Rollup” mentality to the next level with dynamic rollups based on what type of record is connected to the record. An awesome scenario that can show you how to take your automation to the next level! Also, lots of great questions so plenty for everyone of all skills to learn from.

    Read More

    November 18, 2018

  • Automation Hour w/ Meighan Brodkey 3: Flow Components

    The Presentation I was honored be a guest presenter on Automation Hour for the 3rd time in 2018. Within the last year salesforce released the ability to use Lightning Components within Visual Workflow.  This allows for massive amounts of increased functionality, as well as the ability to do smaller amounts of development when the out of […]

    Read More

    November 18, 2018

  • DF18: Deliver Personalized Content with CMS and Audience Targeting on Community Cloud

    Hear from 4 Community Cloud Experts on the latest and Greatest available for Content Management!  Learn how easy it is to seamlessly integrate your Content Management System (CMS) into Lightning Communities with CMS Connect

    Read More

    November 18, 2018

  • Decoding Developers: Level Up Your Admin Career

    What happens when an Admin, an “Admineloper” and a Salesforce Developer discuss what really matters to them? Well, last year the 3 Amigas, Meighan Brodkey, Leslie Gestautas, and Jean Velonis had the idea to share their stories with others in the session Level Up Your Admin Career, Secrets from Developers. This session is back with a twist, new stories, new best practices, and more at Dreamforce 18.

    Read More

    November 18, 2018

  • Dreamforce 18

    October 2018[addtoany buttons=’Twitter,facebook,linkedin,email’] Overview This Dreamforce I was honored to present 3 different sessions.Decoding Developers from DF17 was back! Sadly Leslie was unable to join us, but Jean and I presented with Ashley Allen.Then I had the Community Demo Jam where I completed against Nathan Pepper showing off our custom themes for the COmmunity CLoud. […]

    Read More

    November 5, 2018

  • Force Academy LA, 18

    Build a Lightning Community in a Flash Force Academy LA – May 19, 2018[addtoany media=”https://i1.wp.com/meighanrockssf.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/forceAcademyLA18.jpg?resize=480%2C480&ssl=1″ buttons=’Twitter,facebook,linkedin,email’] Build a Lightning Community in a Flash Overview Overview of what the Lightning Community Templates are, how they are accessed and the differences between Customer Service (Napili), Customer Account Portal, Build Your Own, and Partner Central templates. What a […]

    Read More

    September 3, 2018

  • Intro to Lightning Community Templates – Chicago World Tour 17

    Introduction to Lightning Communities OOTB Features and Functionality, Community Builder, and More…Chicago World TourJuly 2017 Overview Overview of what the Lightning Community Templates are, how they are accessed and the differences between Customer Service vs Partner Central templates. Review of the OOTB Components that are available in builder. How to plan your community implementation, requirements […]

    Read More

    January 22, 2018

  • Getting Started w/ Lightning Templates Surf Force 17

    Getting Started with Lightning Community Templates Surf Force September 22, 2017Bundoran, Ireland Surf Force 2017 Overview Overview of what the Lightning Community Templates are, how they are accessed and the differences between Customer Service vs Partner Central templates. Review of the OOTB Components that are available in builder. How to plan your community implementation, requirements gathering, […]

    Read More

    January 22, 2018

  • It Simply Works Until It Doesn’t Tahoe Dreamin 18

    It Simply Works… Until it Doesn’t At Tahoe Dreamin’ 2018, Daniel Stange and I, Meighan Brodkey, presented on the Admin track.  Salesforce empowers non-programmers to become App Builders and declarative developers in ways that administrators could only dream of before Visual Workflow and Process Builder had been introduced. Consequently, with great powers comes great responsibility. […]

    Read More

    January 21, 2018

  • Automation Hour W/ Guest Presenter Meighan Brodkey Auto-Add Users to Chatter Groups

    Automation Hour W/ Guest Presenter Meighan Brodkey December 16, 2016See how you can auto-add users to Chatter Groups when edited or created using clicks not code.  Using a List Custom Setting, a Flow, and a Process, you can automation the creation of Chatter Group members for your internal and external Users as an admin, without […]

    Read More

    January 17, 2018

  • The Ultimate Admin Royal Rumble: 6 CRM Hacks, 1 Champion

    The Ultimate Admin Royal Rumble: 6 Crm Hacks, 1 Champion 2017 The Apttus Hack Battle at their Accelerate Summit. Three of us competed, we had 2 hacks each that we demoed for the audience.  They watched and voted for the winner.  The Competitors were the 2016 Champion Adam Olshansky, Guarev Kheterpal, and myself, Meighan Brodkey. […]

    Read More

    January 11, 2018

  • Dreamforce 2017

    Dreamforce 2017 presentation, What happens when an Admin, an “Admineloper” and a Salesforce Developer discuss what really matters to them? 3 devoted Salesforce pros share experiences & offer tips to devs that would take months (or years) to learn. Learn common misunderstandings btw Admins & Developers, gotchas & more

    Read More

    January 11, 2018
